title: Normal growth and development of Infant

questions.question: The second year of life is the period of most rapid gain in physical size and development.
....... period starts at the end of the first month up to first year of life.
The average weight infant gain during first 4 months is:
The infant double birth weight by:
The infant will triple birth weight by 10 months.
The average length of an infant at 6 months is:
Infant length increases about 2.5 cm/month during first 6 months.
What happens to infant length during second 6 months?
The average length of an infant at 12 months is 65 cm.
The posterior fontanel usually closes by:
Head circumference increases each month during first 6 months by about:
By the end of first year the chest circumference is:
The normal temperature of infant is:
The normal infant pulse rate is:
The normal respiratory rate of an infant is range from 25–45.
Normal blood pressure of an infant is 80/50 ±20/10.
Tooth eruption usually begin at:
The first teeth to erupt are the upper central incisors.
Infant will have ...... teeth at the end of first year.
Number of deciduous teeth by 2.5 to 3 years is about:
Milky teeth or deciduous teeth are called like this because they are replaced by permanent teeth in late childhood.
The lower lateral teeth erupt at .... months.
The lower first two molar erupt at ..... months.
The lower central incisor erupt at ..... months.
Preference for food taste appear at ... months.
Infant follows moving person nearby at ....
Infant will have hand-eye coordination at ....
Infant visual acuity is 6/6 at ....
The infant follow object through transition from one place to another by 6 months.
Infant has binocular coordination at 3 months.
Rolling from front to back occurs at about:
Sitting with slight support occurs at 5 months.
Hold head erect in mid position occurs at about ....
Holding a cup occurs at:
Infant sits alone at:
Infant walk with help at:
Turn completely over occurs at 5 months.
Infant can hold head erect and steady while in sitting position at 5 months.
Crawl means use hands and legs.
Infant can creep well at 9 months.
Stand erect with minimal support is at 12 months.
Sitting down from standing position alone occur at ....
Stand alone occurs at 9 months.
Infant walk holding furniture at 11 months.
Piaget's cognitive development stage is called:
Freud's stage for infancy is called anal stage.
Erikson's psychosexual stage is called trust versus mistrust.
Oral stage extends from:
Loud laughing usually appears at 4 months.
Cradle hold is a technique used for washing infant's head over a basin.
At first year old the infant sleeps about 12 h out of 24 h.
Failure to sit alone by 6 months is a red flag.
The infant red flag is about failure to speak recognizable words by ....
Infant can vocalize da, ma, pa at 9 months.
